    my-vignette

A nonparametric estimator for lagged association rate

Source: R/lar_nonparametric_estimation.R
lar_nonparametric_estimation.Rd

A nonparametric estimator for lagged association rate

Usage

lar_nonparametric_estimation(X, tp, group_id = NULL)

Arguments

X

A list or matrix containing the identities of individuals within study area, and the states or status of individuals during each sampling period.

tp

A set of observation time.

group_id

Groups of individuals. If X is a list, please input group_id. If X is a matrix, this parameter can be skipped and takes the default NULL value.

Value

A list with the following elements:

tau

a set of time lags

gtau

A nonparametric estimator of \(\hat{g}(\tau)\) was given by Whitehead (2007)

g_m

\(\sum_{i,j} \{A_{t_i,t_j}|\tau_{ij}=\tau\}\), with \(\tau_{ij}=|t_i-t_j|\)

g_n

\(\sum_{i,j} \{A_i|\tau_{ij}=\tau\}\), with \(\tau_{ij}=|t_i-t_j|\)

Aij

number of associations of pair of individuals at both time \(t_i\) and \(t_j\)

Ai

number of associations of pair of individuals at time \(t_i\)

tauij

\(\tau_{ij}=|t_i-t_j|\)

Details

The lagged association rate \(g(\tau)\) is the probability that if two individuals are associated now, they will still be associated after a time lag of \(\tau\). A nonparametric estimator of \(g(\tau)\) was given by Whitehead (2007): $$\hat{g}(\tau)=\frac{\sum_{i,j} \{A_{t_i,t_j}|\tau_{ij}=\tau\}}{\sum_{i,j}\{A_i|\tau_{ij}=\tau\}},$$ where where \(A_{t_i,t_j}\) is the number of associations of pair of individuals at both time \(t_i\) and \(t_j\), and \(A_{t_i}\) represents the number of associations of pair of individuals at time \(t_i\).
